SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
CONTACT DATA AND AUDIENCES
Audience Builder

Segment your customers in a variety of ways with Audience Builder in any Marketing Cloud Engagement org. Enterprise 2.0 customers can contact an account executive to enable additional features, such as business unit filters.

Audiences

An audience represents a collection of contacts that are grouped based on attributes that are used when they receive a message. An audience draws information from a sendable data extension. Audience Builder sets a flag in the header of the data extension noting it as an audience. Outbound Mail Manager (OMM) uses this information to determine which channel, audience, and segment engaged the contact with a message.

You can publish an audience for use in a send or other activities.

Audience Builder can use any lists, groups, or data extensions linked through a common subscriber key or ID. You can add attributes to Audience Builder without adding more dimensions to them. Audience Builder only supports queries performed via the expression builder.

NOTE We recommend using a subscriber key with Audience Builder. You can implement Audience Builder to use the email address as the customer key.

To send an email via Marketing Cloud Engagement, use the audience data extension template. When sending to the audience object, subscriber behavior is tracked in the template. Audience Builder also supports other channels, such as mobile and social.

You can use audiences for suppression with user-initiated and wizard-based sending tools.

Audiences can include ID and code values:

IDs and Codes represent distinct entities.
Audience Builder requires IDs. Codes represent optional values.
IDs uniquely identify the audience object.
IDs help reporting and tracking activities. Use these values to manage audiences and segments.
The Summary screen lists a field labeled Audience ID that actually displays a code value.
Codes don’t require unique values. You can use any applicable value as a code.
Codes help manage or associate an audience with a campaign.

Audience Builder lists activities in Automation Studio under Data Factory and the Audience Builder Folder. To pick an audience to refresh, use the Build Audience activity.

Segments

A segment represents a group of people who meet a set of user-defined criteria. Use segments for analysis and for targeting in an audience. If you choose not to add a filter, Audience Builder builds segments using the entire available population of contacts from your account. Audiences don’t require segments or audience filters.

You can append attributes to segments in the Publish tab. Appending attributes to segments associates contact content with a segment. Also, you can use AMPscript and Server-Side JavaScript to power a content decision in email. The action is based on a contact’s segment assignment in a specific audience.

Reporting

You can use audiences and segments for reporting. Audience Builder provides a report in the standard email reports section that breaks down the campaign metrics by segment name.

Performance

Every Audience Builder implementation has unique performance characteristics. Work with your implementation team to understand performance expectations.

All systems that process more instructions take longer to complete, but this operation can occur many times faster than a standard query.

We recommend one refresh of Audience Builder data per day. The refresh updates lists and data extensions.

Enterprise Accounts

Audience Builder limits the number of values per dimension to under 1,000. You can use attributes with more than 100 values. Also, you can manage the total at the enterprise, such as 100 dimensions in business unit A and 100 dimensions in business unit B. With this method, despite the same number of dimensions in both business units, the dimensions aren’t from the same dataset. By using the custom attribute selectors, such as starts with, ends with, contains, greater than, and less than, users can access all the values stored in the attribute and use that for criteria in a selection.

Get Started with Audience Builder
Audience Builder dynamically creates targeted audiences from contacts stored in your account based on stored attribute and behavioral values. Use these audiences to either target or exclude contacts from activities in Marketing Cloud Engagement.
Filter Tab
The Filter tab in Audience Builder allows you to take your total population and query it to match the subscriber data of interest. Filter an audience either for send purposes, such as sending emails to specific subscribers that match your query target. You can also filter for analytic purposes, such as examining the number of subscribers that match a given criteria.
Exclusions Tab
Use the Exclusions tab in Audience Builder to create suppression criteria from your attribute library. You can then remove a subset of contacts from a filtered audience or segment.
Segment Tab
Segment an audience in Audience Builder to suppress certain subscribers from either your total population or a filtered population.
Audience Publishing
After you filter and segment your audience in Audience Builder, you can publish your audience as a publish definition. Publish definitions represent data extensions containing the filter and segment data you defined in the audience. Use publish definitions across the Marketing Cloud in other applications. Access your published definition in the Audience data extension folder, located in Email Studio under the Subscribers tab.
Dimension Packages
Dimension packages describe the way you use Audience Builder to interact with the subscriber data in Marketing Cloud Engagement. Dimension packages translate raw subscriber attributes into readable information in your Attribute Library. Use this information to build and segment audiences.
Audience Builder for Administrators
A Marketing Cloud Engagement admin can manage user access to Audience Builder attributes, existing dimensions, and segment templates.
Audience Builder Attribute Library
Use the Attribute Library in Audience Builder to drag subscriber criteria onto the canvas as you filter or segment your audience. The Attribute Library displays raw subscriber data as readable attribute labels. The data that appears in the Attribute Library depends on the Data Packages in your Marketing Cloud Engagement org.
Audience Builder Scenarios
Review these Audience Builder scenarios for examples on how to use this Marketing Cloud Engagement feature. These scenarios use sample data that doesn’t always match your own data.
Audiences and Segments
These diagrams show the relationship between audience filters and segments in Audience Builder for Marketing Cloud Engagement.
Operator Use Cases
When you define and segment your audience in Audience Builder, work with operators to change the logic of your expressions.
Publish an Audience to Salesforce Data Extension Folder
Publish an audience of your subscribers to the Salesforce data extension folder so that you can use a user-initiated Salesforce send. Marketing Cloud Engagement receives only subscriber tracking data that’s returned from Salesforce. Subscribers without a Salesforce ID can’t send data back to Salesforce.
Automation Studio Activities for Audience Builder
You can increase productivity in Marketing Cloud Engagement when you use a combination of tools. Audience Builder actions are available as activities in Automation Studio and are related to an Email Studio program. Add one or more activities to an automation to accomplish your tasks.
Supported Characters for Audience Builder
Audience Builder supports these characters for the specified locations.

title: Using Audience Builder in Marketing Cloud Engagement
